name: An Interactive Fog of War for Network States
description: This session will present our learnings in developing an interactive fog of war for the onchain strategy game Network States, enabling player A to alter player B's shielded state. Going beyond pproaches solely reliant on zero-knowledge, fully homomorphic encryption, or multi-party computation, we chose a novel method that hinges on hardware-based trust for state concealment, supplemented with cryptographic and proof-of-stake assumptions.

speakers.name: Lyron Co Ting Keh
speakers.bio: Areas of interest include recursion [eg. Zator: verified inference of a 512 layer CNN using Nova], threshold schemes [eg. Proactive Refresh: cycling key shares for threshold signatures], and low-level cryptography [eg. KZG Chip: an optimized multi-open verifier in Halo2].
